summary.para: The optional parameters for configuring the service host. This enumeration is used within the structure when calling or by itself when calling .
A void pointer used with . This property is made available to different callbacks and service operations as part of the WS_OPERATION_CONTEXT structure
A value used with . This property is used to specify the disclosure level of the error object when its converted into a fault. The default is WS_MINIMAL_FAULT_DISCLOSURE.
A LANGID used with to create a fault. If none is specified, the default user locale will be used.
A value used with that specifies the current state of the service host.
The returned value is a snapshot of the current state, so it is possible that the state may have changed before the caller has had a chance to examine the value.
A structure used with that contains the collection of metadata documents used for WS-MetadataExchange by the WS_SERVICE_HOST.
The service name and namespace are used to create a service element inside the WSDL document. The document is identified by means of the service namespace provided as part of structure.
Note that if a service section is already defined in any of the provided WSDL documents, a service element will not be added on behalf of the application by the runtime.

A ULONG used with that specifies the maximum amount of time a service model will wait after is called. Once the timeout expires service host will abort itself. The default is 5 seconds specified in milliseconds as 5000.
